title: Unfinished Kebaya with Sunflower Embroidery
content:

 part) womenswear kebayas

  title_text: Unfinished Kebaya with Sunflower Embroidery

  preference: main

  title_language: 

  creation_date: early-mid 20th century

  creation_place_original_location: Java (Indonesia)

  inscriptions: 

  inscription_language: 

  shape: irregular

  materials_name: cotton (textile)

  techniques_name: sewing (needleworking technique) embroidering

  object_colour: orange (color)

  physical_appearance: This is an unfinished kebaya. It has been cut from fabric. It is orange with a yellow grid pattern. There are some unfinished embroidery of flowers and foliage at the front and sleeves.

  subject_terms_1: tops (garments
 general) flowers (motifs) Peranakan unfinished kebayas embroidery (visual works) folk costume

  subject_terms_2: Motifs Textiles Ethnic costume Peranakan (Asian people) Embroidery

  subject_terms_3: Peranakan costumes

  sgcool_label_text: This kebaya has been cut from its fabric but remains unfinished. The orange fabric features a yellow grid pattern. Embroidery of sunflowers and foliage seem to be most finished at the sleeves
 though some work had been started at the front. Drawings in black give a glimpse of the intended design. Kebayas with elongated tapered ends were popular in the 1930s and many were commissioned by Peranakan women. It is part of a donation which contains a mixture of garments worn by Peranakan men and women.
